<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>WPP plc </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Translation of
registrant&#146;s name into English) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><center>

Containers, 18 Upper Ground </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>London, United Kingdom SE1 9GL </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Address of principal executive offices) </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><center>
<P STYLE="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000;width:21%">&nbsp;</P></center> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Indicate by check mark whether
the registrant files or will file annual reports under cover of Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">20-F</FONT> or Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">40-F:</FONT> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Form
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">20-F&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9746;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><U></U>Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">40-F&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9744;</FONT> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Indicate by check mark if the registrant is submitting the Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">6-K</FONT> in paper as permitted by Regulation <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">S-T</FONT> Rule 101(b)(1):&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9744; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Note</B>:&nbsp;Regulation <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">S-T</FONT> Rule
101(b)(1) only permits the submission in paper of a Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">6-K</FONT> if submitted solely to provide an attached annual report to security holders. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Indicate by check mark if the registrant is submitting the Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">6-K</FONT> in paper as permitted by Regulation <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">S-T</FONT> Rule 101(b)(7):&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9744; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Note:</B>&nbsp;Regulation <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">S-T</FONT> Rule
101(b)(7) only permits the submission in paper of a Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">6-K</FONT> if submitted to furnish a report or other document that the registrant foreign private issuer must furnish and make public under the laws of the
jurisdiction in which the registrant is incorporated, domiciled or legally organized (the registrant&#146;s &#147;home country&#148;), or under the rules of the home country exchange on which the registrant&#146;s securities are traded, as long as
the report or other document is not a press release, is not required to be and has not been distributed to the registrant&#146;s security holders, and, if discussing a material event, has already been the subject of a Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">6-K</FONT> submission or other Commission filing on EDGAR. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:1.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</P>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Forward-Looking Statements </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with the provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 (the &#147;Reform Act&#148;), WPP plc and its
subsidiaries (the &#147;Company&#148;) may include forward-looking statements (as defined in the Reform Act) in oral or written public statements issued by or on behalf of the Company. These forward-looking statements may include, among other
things, plans, objectives, projections and anticipated future economic performance based on assumptions and the like that are subject to risks and uncertainties. As such, actual results or outcomes may differ materially from those discussed in the
forward-looking statements. Important factors that may cause actual results to differ include but are not limited to: the unanticipated loss of a material client or key personnel, delays or reductions in client advertising budgets, shifts in
industry rates of compensation, regulatory compliance costs or litigation, natural disasters or acts of terrorism, the Company&#146;s exposure to changes in the values of major currencies other than the UK pound sterling (because a substantial
portion of its revenues are derived and costs incurred outside of the United Kingdom) and the overall level of economic activity in the Company&#146;s major markets (which varies depending on, among other things, regional, national and international
political and economic conditions and government regulations in the world&#146;s advertising markets). In addition, you should consider the risks described in Item 3D, captioned &#147;Risk Factors&#148; in the Company&#146;s Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">20-F</FONT> for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2018, which could also cause actual results to differ from forward-looking information. In light of these and other uncertainties, the forward-looking statements included in
the oral or written public statements should not be regarded as a representation by the Company that the Company&#146;s plans and objectives will be achieved. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The Company undertakes no obligation to update or revise any such forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or
otherwise. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>EXHIBIT INDEX </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:11pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.50em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:11pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Billings</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>53,059</B></FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

exceptional gain that has not been repeated (</B><B>&pound;</B><B>73</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;million impact) and a charge on the revaluation of financial instruments versus a credit in 2018 (</B><B>&pound;</B><B>238</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;million impact)</B>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="left">Prior year figures have been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> in accordance with IFRS 5: <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, as described in note 2 of Appendix&nbsp;1 </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">5</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="left">Headline EBITDA (including depreciation of
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> assets) </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">6</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="left">Headline measures, diluted EPS and net working capital are defined in Appendix 1 </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">7</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 2
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:14pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Strategic highlights and 2020 guidance </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>Renewed commitment to creativity and collaboration</B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>Simpler structure with fewer, stronger agency brands</B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>Investments in technology, HR and client</B><B></B><B>&nbsp;&amp; new business teams</B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>Stronger balance sheet and share <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">buy-back</FONT> programme commenced </B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>2020 guidance: flat revenue less pass-through costs, flat headline operating profit margin</B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>2021 targets reiterated: organic growth in line with peers, headline operating profit margin at least 15%</B>
</P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt"><B>2020 guidance made prior to any impact from the coronavirus outbreak</B> </P></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Mark Read, Chief Executive Officer, WPP: </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">&#147;2019 was the foundational year for the new WPP strategy, and thanks to the hard work of all our colleagues we have made substantial progress in a
short period of time.</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">&#147;We said that we would make progress in the journey to return WPP to growth, simplifying our business and reducing our
debt, and we have delivered against each of these goals &#150; having met our guidance for 2019, achieved our restructuring targets and completed the sale of a majority stake in Kantar. The second half of 2019 was stronger than the first, with
performance improving globally and in the United States, our largest market. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">&#147;Our new offer of creativity powered by technology has resonated
with clients, as we&#146;ve seen in good retention rates and important wins. New creative assignments include Instagram and Mondelez, and AXA, eBay and Hasbro were among the media wins. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">&#147;Perhaps most importantly, our clients and our people tell us that WPP has a clear new sense of purpose and is successfully instilling a culture of
creativity, collaboration and openness. As we enter the second year of our three-year turnaround plan, our ability to attract and retain the best people is key to long-term growth. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">&#147;I am optimistic about the future of our industry and WPP&#146;s position within it, although there is still much more work to do. The marketing
landscape has never been more dynamic and complex: clients need our help and expertise more than ever. With our market-leading scale and global footprint, allied to the creativity of our agencies and our technology leadership, we are confident of
further progress against our 2021 targets.&#148; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">For further information: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><B>Investors and analysts </B></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt" ALIGN="center">

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 3
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#0000ff"><U>wpp.com/investors</U> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">This announcement is being distributed to all owners of Ordinary shares. Copies are available to the public at the Company&#146;s
registered office. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">The following cautionary statement is included for safe harbour purposes in connection with the
Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 introduced in the United States of America. This announcement may contain forward-looking statements within the meaning of the US federal securities laws. These statements are subject to risks and
uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially including adjustments arising from the annual audit by management and the Company&#146;s independent auditors. For further information on factors which could impact the Company and
the statements contained herein, please refer to public filings by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The statements in this announcement should be considered in light of these risks and uncertainties. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><I>In this press release not all of the figures and ratios used are readily available from the unaudited preliminary results included in Appendix 1.
These <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures, including constant currency and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> growth, revenue less pass-through costs<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"> </SUP>and headline profit measures, management believes are both useful and necessary to better understand the Group&#146;s results. Where required, details of how these have been arrived at are shown in
Appendix 1. </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Overview and strategic progress </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In December 2018, WPP announced the results of a strategic review, setting out a new plan to return the business to sustainable growth. We are
repositioning WPP as a creative transformation company with an offer extending beyond communications, into large-scale and higher-growth markets in experience, commerce and technology. This reflects the broadening needs of our clients to reach and
engage with customers across multiple platforms. Our progress against the four pillars of this strategy &#150; creativity, data and technology, a simpler structure and our own culture &#150; is set out below. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Creativity </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In
our strategic review, we made a renewed commitment to creativity, our most important competitive advantage, including a plan to invest an incremental &pound;15&nbsp;million a year for the next three years in creative leadership, with a particular
focus on the United States. Over the last year, we have succeeded in attracting a number of industry-leading creative talents into senior creative roles. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Super Bowl is the most high-profile sporting and marketing event in the United States, and has become a celebration not only of TV advertising but
also modern marketing in all its forms. In 2020, WPP&#146;s clients had eight spots featuring during the game, many of which were integrated with social media platforms. We also achieved a number of significant new creative business wins, including
Instagram and Mondelez (Ogilvy), Duracell (Wunderman Thompson) and VodafoneZiggo (an integrated WPP team in the Netherlands). Media wins included AXA (Wavemaker) and Signet (Mediacom). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Our creativity and the impact of our clients&#146; campaigns continue to be recognised in awards. At the 2019 Cannes Lions International Festival of
Creativity in June, WPP agencies won a total of 187 Lions including five Grand Prix, Mindshare was named media network of the year and VMLY&amp;R was named &#147;Reach&#148; agency of the year for work in social media and creative data. At the
Effies, WPP was named the&nbsp;Most Effective Agency Holding Group, the eighth year in a row. Mediacom UK also received deserved recognition as media agency of the decade by Campaign magazine, for the second decade in a row. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Data and technology </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Technology is shaping the present and the future for us and our clients, and touches everything we do. Today, more than half of global media spend is in
new channels, traditional TV viewing for <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">18-34</FONT> year-olds in the US has fallen by 40% in the last four years, and almost all retail sales growth comes from <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">e-commerce.</FONT>
Seven of the world&#146;s ten biggest companies are technology businesses; five of them did not even exist 30 years ago. We are evolving our business to reflect these shifts. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 4
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Central to our technology strategy is our close alignment to the largest and most disruptive technology
companies. Through our strategic partnerships with the likes of Adobe, Amazon, Facebook, Google, IBM and Microsoft, we are engaging in joint product development, gaining preferential access to their technology and media opportunities, and training
our people with the relevant platform skills. There are very strong <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">two-way</FONT> ties: Google is now our second largest client globally, as well as our largest media partner. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We are also working to harness the best of our agencies&#146; own technology and data to make them available across the business. We are investing in WPP
Open as our common technology platform that combines the leading solutions, applications and data from across WPP, supported by third-party partnerships, to help us deliver creative transformation. WPP Open is due to launch in 2020 and will build in
scale throughout the year. We have significant data resources within WPP, but its value is less in ownership and more in how it is combined with client first-party data and other third-party data sources to build successful campaigns. This is the
underlying principle of our data strategy. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">To meet our clients&#146; changing needs, we also need to develop new skills in our people, and to do so
at scale. We are focused on three streams: modern marketing technology, creative&nbsp;&amp; production and digital media platforms. We now have over 60,000 people certified in one or more key products and platforms. In the next two years, we plan to
train 50,000 people to be able to articulate the power of Artificial Intelligence and its value to clients, and to accredit 5,000 data scientists, engineers and creative technologists in the key marketing technologies. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Simpler structure </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We are creating a simpler structure for WPP, to make it easier for clients to access our skills and resources, and the company more straightforward to
manage. The new organisation is based on three principles: an absolute focus on the needs of our clients in everything we do; fewer, stronger WPP companies, each positioned to grow; and more closely integrated operations at the country level to
facilitate collaboration and leverage our collective strengths. We have made the following progress on clients, countries and companies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><I>Clients
&#150; </I>during the year we invested significantly in developing our dedicated client leadership teams. We have brought in new talent, with skills in technology, consulting or specific industry knowledge. We have also committed more to learning
and development, and best practice sharing. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2019, our top 30 clients accounted for almost 30% of revenue less pass-through costs. 14 out of the
30 delivered organic growth in revenue less pass-through costs, an improvement on the figure in 2018 and well on our way to our 2021 target of more than 20. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Looking more broadly across our client base to the top 200, representing over 50% of revenue less pass-through costs in 2019, our Consumer Packaged Goods
clients returned to growth as a category, which was very encouraging. Technology and Luxury&nbsp;&amp; Premium Goods continue to be strong growth drivers, but we saw declines in Automotive, Financial Services and Healthcare&nbsp;&amp; Pharma, all
connected to specific assignment losses in 2018. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><I>Countries &#150; </I>one of the strengths of WPP is its wide geographic footprint, with a
significant presence both in the largest advertising markets such as the US and the UK, and in the faster growing economies such as China, India and Brazil. Although we remain organised firmly along agency lines, country managers play a key
leadership role in client engagement, collaboration, talent management and culture. This has become increasingly the case as we roll out our campus strategy globally. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><I>Companies &#150; </I>a key element of our simplification strategy has been to develop fewer, stronger agency brands, each equipped to serve clients
with an integrated offer and making </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 5
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">
WPP easier to manage and easier for clients to navigate. The mergers in 2018 of VML with Y&amp;R, and Wunderman with J Walter Thompson, to form VMLY&amp;R and Wunderman Thompson respectively,
were the cornerstones of this strategy. In the second half of 2019 VMLY&amp;R returned to growth. Wunderman Thompson also showed significant improvement in the second half, as the benefits of the recent merger began to be realised. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We have made excellent progress towards simplifying WPP in the last 12 months, building on the strong start made in 2018. We have met or exceeded all of
our targets, with 100 office mergers completed or in progress, 80 business units closed or in the process of closing and approximately 3,500 planned redundancies implemented. The gross savings for 2019 are in line with the &pound;160&nbsp;million
estimate in December 2018. As previously announced, a proportion of these gross savings are being reinvested in talent and technology development. To date, we have made limited progress in rolling out our shared service centres and common IT
infrastructure and these remain an opportunity. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><I>Kantar</I> - In December 2019 we completed the transaction to sell a 60% stake in Kantar to Bain
Capital Private Equity to form a strong partnership to accelerate Kantar&#146;s development. In addition to the potential in our remaining 40% investment in Kantar, the cash proceeds of approximately &pound;2.4&nbsp;billion have enabled us to reduce
our debt significantly while also planning to return approximately &pound;950&nbsp;million to WPP shareholders by way of a share <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">buy-back.</FONT> As at 26&nbsp;February 2020, &pound;247&nbsp;million of this had
already been completed. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Other disposals during the year, including our investments in Chime, The Farm and freehold property in New York realised
&pound;344&nbsp;million. Including Kantar, the total proceeds from all disposals in the last two years amount to approximately &pound;3.3&nbsp;billion. Our disposal programme is substantially complete, with over 50 businesses or investments sold in
the last 18 months. We will continue to review our portfolio to maximise value for our shareholders. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Culture and ESG
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Culture has always played an important part in the success of our individual agencies, as in all people businesses. However, there has
not historically been a unified cultural vision across WPP. Through a clear common purpose, as well as an increasing commitment to collaboration, this is beginning to change. As a partner to many of the world&#146;s largest and most influential
businesses, we are also well positioned to be agents of change on a broader platform. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Our purpose is to use the power of creativity to build a
better future for our people, clients and communities. Our workforce has an equal gender balance overall, and 50% of our senior managers are women (2018: 49%). At the Board level, 6 out of 15 of Board members are women and we are aiming to get to
parity. In November 2019, we underscored this commitment by joining the 30% Club, a group of Chairs and CEOs campaigning for greater female representation in business leadership. We were also included in the 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for
the second year running. As an inclusive business, we signed up to the Valuable500, a global initiative that is putting disability on the boardroom agenda. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">At both Board and executive level, there have been significant changes in how WPP operates. During 2019 we added Board skills in technology, marketing
and sustainability. We have established a Board Sustainability Committee, on which both the CEO and CFO sit, as well as experienced <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-Executive</FONT> Directors. The WPP Executive Committee, convened for the first
time in 2019 and comprising agency CEOs and key central function leads, meets regularly to review performance, enhance collaboration and develop strategy. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 6
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We are changing our workplaces to foster collaboration and develop attractive working environments,
with a goal to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-locate</FONT> over half of our workforce in campuses by 2023. As at December 2019 we had launched campuses in 17 cities, with New York, Amsterdam, Madrid and Mumbai all completing during the year.
These campuses are not only great places to work and present the best of WPP to clients in one place, but also drive efficiency through shared overhead and the removal of duplication. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We also want to instil a growth culture and to that end we have redesigned bonus incentives to align with our strategy for growth. In 2019, financial
targets were weighted 50% to revenue less pass-through costs performance, whereas the focus in recent years has been exclusively on profit growth and margin improvement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Another area where we are accelerating action is plastic waste. In 2019, we pledged to phase out plastics that cannot be reused, recycled or composted
from all WPP offices by the end of 2020, and to work with clients to tackle plastic waste. We also signed up to the New Plastics Economy Global Commitment led by the UN Environment Programme and the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, which aims to create a
circular economy where no plastic goes to waste. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Our use of renewable energy rose to 35%, with 100% of electricity in the US purchased from
renewable sources. In November, Mindshare one of our leading media agencies, launched #<I>ChangeTheBrief </I>&#150; a new approach to marketing planning&nbsp;designed to encourage behaviour change in the face of the Climate Crisis. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Financial results </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The financial
results for 2019 are based on the Group&#146;s continuing operations and exclude the results of Kantar which are shown separately as discontinued operations. The 2018 reported numbers have been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> in
accordance with IFRS 5, to reflect this change. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Reported billings were &pound;53.059&nbsp;billion, down 0.3%, down 1.4% in constant currency and
down 1.0% <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like.</FONT></FONT> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Reported revenue was up 1.4% at
&pound;13.234&nbsp;billion. Revenue on a constant currency basis was up 0.2% compared with last year, the difference to the reportable number reflecting the weakness of the pound sterling against most currencies, particularly in the first half of
the year. On a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> basis, which excludes the impact of currency and acquisitions, revenue was flat. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Reported revenue less pass-through costs was down 0.3%, down 1.5% in constant currency and down 1.6% <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like,</FONT></FONT> within the guidance range of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-1.5%</FONT> to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-2.0%</FONT> <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-confirmed</FONT> in October 2019.
In the fourth quarter, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue was up 0.1%, a deterioration from the third quarter of +1.9%, with the United Kingdom and Western Continental Europe
improving, more than offset by North America and Asia Pacific, Latin America, Africa&nbsp;&amp; the Middle East and Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe which were slower. On the same basis, revenue less pass-through costs in the fourth quarter was
down 1.9%, a deterioration from the improvement seen in the third quarter of +0.5%, with the United Kingdom and Asia Pacific, Latin America, Africa&nbsp;&amp; the Middle East and Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe weaker. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Operating profitability </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Reported profit before tax fell by 21.9% to &pound;982&nbsp;million from &pound;1.258&nbsp;billion, the difference between the headline and reported
figures reflecting principally the &pound;153&nbsp;million of restructuring and transformation costs and &pound;48&nbsp;million of goodwill impairment charges. In constant currencies, reported profit before tax fell by 22.3%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Reported profit after tax fell by 29.4% to &pound;707&nbsp;million from &pound;1.002&nbsp;billion. In constant currencies, profits after tax fell 30.3%.
</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 7
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline EBITDA was down 5.3% to &pound;1.830&nbsp;billion, from &pound;1.933&nbsp;billion the previous
year and down 5.6% in constant currency. The Group&#146;s revenue is more weighted to the second half of the year across all regions and sectors, and, particularly, in the faster growing markets of Asia Pacific and Latin America. As a result,
profitability and margin continue to be skewed to the second half of the year, with the Group earning approximately 40% of its profits in the first half and 60% in the second half. Headline operating profit for 2019 was down 5.5% to
&pound;1.561&nbsp;billion, from &pound;1.651&nbsp;billion and down 5.6% in constant currencies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline operating margin<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">8</SUP> was down 0.8 margin points to 14.4%, down 0.6 margin points in constant currency and down 1.2 margin points
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like.</FONT></FONT> The difference between the constant currency and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> margin
reflects the impact of IFRS 16: Leases. The Group&#146;s operating margin of 14.4% is after charging &pound;43&nbsp;million of severance costs, compared with &pound;30&nbsp;million in 2018 and &pound;294&nbsp;million of incentive payments, which
were 15.8% of operating profit before incentives, a similar level to the &pound;311&nbsp;million or 15.9% in 2018. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s headline
operating margin, excluding all incentives<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">9</SUP> and income from associates, was 17.1%, down 0.9 margin points, compared with 18.0% last year. The Group&#146;s staff costs to revenue less pass-through
costs ratio, including severance and incentives, increased by 1.5 margin points to 65.4% compared to 63.9% in 2018. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">On a <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> basis, the average number of people in the Group, excluding associates, in 2019 was 106,508 compared to 106,555 in 2018. On the same basis, the total number of
people, excluding associates, at 31&nbsp;December 2019 was 106,786 compared to 105,900 at 31&nbsp;December 2018, an increase of 0.8%. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
 COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Exceptional gains and restructuring and transformation costs </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">As outlined in the Investor Day on 11&nbsp;December
2018, we have undertaken a strategic review of our operations. As part of that review, restructuring actions have been taken to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-size</FONT> underperforming businesses, address high cost severance markets and
simplify operational structures.&nbsp;This has included a number of WPP&#146;s operating companies having been merged, closed or sold. It also includes transformation costs with respect to strategic initiatives like
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-locations</FONT> in major cities, IT transformation and shared services. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2019, the Group recorded
&pound;121&nbsp;million of restructuring and transformation costs in relation to this plan, in addition to the &pound;212&nbsp;million in 2018. Of this &pound;333&nbsp;million total, &pound;220&nbsp;million relates to actions with a cash cost, with
&pound;158&nbsp;million paid to date &#150; the balance to be paid in 2020 and beyond. Total restructuring and transformation costs in 2019 of &pound;153&nbsp;million comprises the &pound;121&nbsp;million above and &pound;32&nbsp;million of other
costs, primarily relating to the continuing global IT transformation programme. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">These exceptional costs of &pound;153&nbsp;million and
&pound;48&nbsp;million of associate company exceptional losses have been partly offset by exceptional gains of &pound;58&nbsp;million, primarily relating to the gain on the sale of the Group&#146;s investment in Chime.</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">This gives a net exceptional loss of &pound;143&nbsp;million and compares with a net exceptional loss in 2018 of &pound;70&nbsp;million. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Discontinued operations </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">As Kantar classifies as held for sale under IFRS 5, the profit for the year is presented as discontinued operations on the income statement. The decrease
in profit for the year from &pound;138&nbsp;million in 2018 to &pound;11&nbsp;million in 2019 primarily reflects the goodwill impairment on </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>

<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">8</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="left">Headline operating profit (excluding income from associates) as a percentage of revenue less pass-through costs
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="left">Short and long-term incentives and the cost of share-based incentives
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 8
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">
classification as held for sale of &pound;95&nbsp;million and the tax expense on the disposal of &pound;157&nbsp;million, partially offset by the gain on sale of &pound;74&nbsp;million. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Interest and taxes </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Net finance costs (excluding the revaluation of financial instruments and interest expense on lease liabilities) were &pound;160&nbsp;million, compared
with &pound;180&nbsp;million in 2018, a decrease of &pound;20&nbsp;million. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The headline tax rate was 22.0% (2018: 20.7%) and on reported profit
before tax was 28.0% (2018: 20.4%), the difference in the reported tax rate in 2019 was principally due to the revaluation of financial instruments not being tax deductible. Given the Group&#146;s geographic mix of profits and the changing
international tax environment, the tax rate is expected to increase slightly over the next few years. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Earnings and
dividend </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline profit before tax was down 11.7% to &pound;1.363&nbsp;billion from &pound;1.543&nbsp;billion, and down 11.6% in
constant currencies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Profits attributable to shareholders fell 33.0% to &pound;628&nbsp;million from &pound;937&nbsp;million, again reflecting
principally the &pound;153&nbsp;million of restructuring and transformation costs and &pound;48&nbsp;million of goodwill impairment. In constant currencies, profits attributable to shareholders fell by 33.8%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline diluted earnings per share, for continuing and discontinued operations, fell by 14.2% to 92.7p from 108.0p. In constant currencies, earnings per
share on the same basis fell by 14.9%. Reported diluted earnings per share, on the same basis, fell by 41.3% to 49.5p from 84.3p and decreased 42.3% in constant currencies. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Your Board proposes to maintain the final dividend of 37.3p per share, which, together with the interim dividend of 22.7p per share, makes a total of
60.0p per share for 2019, the same as the prior year. The record date for the final dividend is 12&nbsp;June 2020, payable on 6&nbsp;July 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Further details of WPP&#146;s financial performance are provided in Appendix 1. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Regional review </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Revenue analysis </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="85%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:11pt">


<TR>

<TD WIDTH="58%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>15.2%&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial">* Headline operating profit as a percentage of revenue less pass-through costs </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">North America</FONT> </B>constant currency revenue less pass-through costs was down 4.4% in the final
quarter, a deterioration from <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-2.3%</FONT> in the third quarter, and down 4.5% <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like,</FONT></FONT> compared with <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-3.5%</FONT> in the third quarter. This reflects slightly weaker performance in the Group&#146;s public relations and specialist agencies. On a full year basis, constant currency revenue less pass-through costs was <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-4.7%,</FONT> with <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-5.7%,</FONT> with a significant improvement in the second half, as the
negative effect of some of the 2018 client assignment losses started to ease. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">United
Kingdom</FONT></B> constant currency revenue less pass-through costs was down 3.3% in the final quarter and down 3.7% <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like.</FONT></FONT> This compares with +0.6% and +3.1%
respectively in the third quarter, with the Group&#146;s global integrated agencies and particularly GroupM, performing less well, partly offset by a significant improvement in the Group&#146;s specialist public relations businesses. On a full year
basis, constant currency revenue less pass-through costs was down 0.3%, with <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> up 0.3%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">Western Continental Europe</FONT> </B>constant currency revenue less pass-through costs was up 1.2% in
the final quarter, weaker than the third quarter +2.4%. On a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> basis revenue less pass-through costs was up 1.3% in the final quarter, also slightly weaker
than the third quarter growth of 1.7%. France, Italy, the Netherlands and Switzerland were softer, partly offset by a significant improvement in Germany in the final quarter. For the year, Western Continental Europe constant currency revenue less
pass-through costs grew 1.0% with <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> up 0.7%, the second strongest performing region. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In<B> <FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">Asia Pacific, Latin America,
Africa</FONT>&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">&amp; the Middle East and Central</FONT>&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial" COLOR="#181b6b">&amp; Eastern Europe</FONT></B>, on a constant currency basis, revenue less pass-through
costs was down 1.7% in the fourth quarter and down 0.2% <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like,</FONT></FONT> somewhat weaker than the third quarter growth of 4.0%. In the fourth quarter,<B> </B>Asia Pacific,
Latin America and Central&nbsp;&amp; Eastern Europe performed less well, with Africa&nbsp;&amp; the Middle East improving. On a full year basis, constant currency revenue less pass-through costs growth in the region was 0.4% with <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> growth 1.4%, the strongest performing region. </P>
</DIV></Center>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>10,876</B></FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline operating profit analysis </B></FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>15.2%</B></FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial">* Headline operating profit as a percentage of revenue less pass-through costs </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In the final quarter of 2019, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through
costs in the Group&#146;s global integrated agencies was <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-0.8%,</FONT> down on the 1.7% growth achieved in the third quarter. Ogilvy and VMLY&amp;R improved over the third quarter, more than offset by lower growth in
Wunderman Thompson, Grey and GroupM. Geographically, North America and Asia Pacific improved, offset by lower growth, particularly in the United Kingdom and Western Continental Europe. On a full year basis <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through costs was down 0.7%, the strongest performing sector. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In the fourth
quarter, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through costs in the Group&#146;s public relations businesses was almost flat at <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-0.1%,</FONT>
a significant improvement over the third quarter <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-0.9%</FONT> and the first half <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-1.5%,</FONT> with H+K Strategies and the specialist public relations businesses Finsbury, Glover
Park, Hering Schuppener, Buchanan and Clarion performing strongly. On a full year basis, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through costs was down 1.0%, with H2 <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-0.4%</FONT> a significant improvement on the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">-1.5%</FONT> in H1. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In the Group&#146;s
specialist agencies, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through costs was down 7.4% in the final quarter, as the Group&#146;s specialist brand consulting, advertising and
direct, interactive and eCommerce businesses came under pressure, particularly in North America Western Continental Europe and Asia Pacific. The Group&#146;s specialist agencies includes the specialist global Ford agency, GTB, and reflects the loss
of the omni-channel work in the second half of 2018. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Cash flow
highlights<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">16</SUP> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2019, operating profit was &pound;1.580&nbsp;billion, depreciation,
amortisation and goodwill impairment &pound;734&nbsp;million, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> share-based incentive charges &pound;71&nbsp;million, working capital and provisions inflow &pound;350&nbsp;million, net interest paid
&pound;190&nbsp;million, tax paid &pound;536 </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">14</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">Percentage change at constant currency exchange rates </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">15</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Like-for-like</FONT></FONT> growth at constant
currency exchange rates and excluding the effects of acquisitions and disposals </P></TD></TR></TABLE>

Appendix 1 </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 11
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">
million, lease liabilities (including interest) paid &pound;355&nbsp;million, capital expenditure &pound;394&nbsp;million, earnout payments &pound;130&nbsp;million and other net cash outflows of
&pound;86&nbsp;million. Free cash flow was, therefore, an inflow of &pound;1.044&nbsp;billion. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">This free cash inflow was enhanced by
&pound;2.221&nbsp;billion in net cash acquisition payments and disposal proceeds (of which &pound;1.971&nbsp;billion was the Kantar disposal net of cash disposed and costs, and &pound;250&nbsp;million of net income from other disposal proceeds net
of acquisition payments) and absorbed by &pound;44&nbsp;million in share <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">buy-backs</FONT> and &pound;750&nbsp;million in dividends. This resulted in a net cash inflow of &pound;2.471&nbsp;billion. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Free cash flow conversion<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">17</SUP> in 2019 was 89%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Balance sheet highlights<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">18</SUP> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Average net debt in 2019 was &pound;4.282&nbsp;billion, compared to &pound;5.025&nbsp;billion in 2018, at 2019 exchange rates. On 31&nbsp;December 2019
net debt was &pound;1.540&nbsp;billion, against &pound;4.017&nbsp;billion on 31&nbsp;December 2018, a decrease of &pound;2.477&nbsp;billion (a decrease of &pound;2.313&nbsp;billion at 2019 exchange rates). The reduced period end debt figure reflects
the benefit of &pound;1.971&nbsp;billion proceeds in relation to the disposal of 60% of the Group&#146;s interest in Phase 1 of the Kantar business. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Return of funds to shareholders </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Funds returned to shareholders in 2019 totalled &pound;794&nbsp;million, including dividends and share <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">buy-backs.</FONT>
In 2019, 4.6&nbsp;million shares, or 0.4% of the issued share capital, were purchased at a cost of &pound;44&nbsp;million. All of these shares were purchased in the fourth quarter. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Outlook </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Financial guidance </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">We have made good progress with our three year strategy during 2019, creating a simpler business, making significant investments for future growth and
strengthening our balance sheet. Our financial performance in the second half of the year showed an encouraging improvement over the first half and gives us confidence of further improvement heading into 2020, as we make progress towards our 2021
goals. Our targets for 2020 are: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through
costs flat, with business performance improving during the year </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt">Headline operating margin to revenue less pass-through costs flat on a constant currency basis </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">This guidance is made prior to any impact from the coronavirus outbreak. At this stage, it is too early to predict the full potential impact. We will
provide an update at our first quarter trading update. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Medium-term financial targets </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">At our Investor Day in December 2018, we set out our new medium-term financial targets that will allow us to invest in talent and technology, improve our
competitive position and deliver sustainable long-term growth rates. We are on track to deliver our financial targets by the end of 2021, which are: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">17</SUP> Free cash flow conversion is the ratio of free cash flow to headline earnings. Free cash flow is after earnouts
and changes in working capital and before new acquisition spend, disposals and shareholder distributions </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">18</SUP> A
summary of the Group&#146;s unaudited balance sheet and notes as at 31&nbsp;December 2019 are provided in Appendix 1 </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 12
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt">Organic growth (defined as <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT>
revenue less pass-through costs growth) in line with peers </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt">Headline operating margin (including the impact of IFRS 16: <I>Leases</I> but now excluding Kantar) of at least 15%
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&pound; million</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Called-up</FONT><BR>share<BR>capital</B></FONT></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP>Acquisition of subsidiaries represents movements in retained earnings and
