<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 19
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>1.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Basis of accounting </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements are prepared under the historical cost convention, except for the revaluation of certain
financial instruments and held for sale assets as disclosed in our accounting policies. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>2.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Accounting policies </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements comply with the recognition and measurement criteria of International Financial Reporting
Standards (IFRS) as adopted by the European Union and issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) and with the accounting policies of the Group which were set out on pages 122 to 126 of the 2018 Annual Report and Accounts. With the
exception of the implementation of IFRS 16: Leases and IFRIC 23: Uncertainty over Income Tax Treatments, which are discussed below, no changes have been made to the Group&#146;s accounting policies in the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2019. As a
result of the Kantar sale (note 13) the Group has added an accounting policy on IFRS 5: <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations which is discussed below. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Whilst the financial information included in this preliminary announcement has been computed in accordance with IFRS, this announcement does not itself
contain sufficient information to comply with all IFRS disclosure requirements. The Company&#146;s 2019 Annual Report and Accounts will be prepared in compliance with IFRS. The unaudited preliminary announcement does not constitute a dissemination
of the annual financial report and does not therefore need to meet the dissemination requirements for annual financial reports. A separate dissemination announcement in accordance with Disclosure and Transparency Rules (DTR) 6.3 will be made when
the annual report and audited financial statements are available on the Company&#146;s website. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Impact of the adoption of IFRS 16: Leases </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">IFRS 16 is effective from 1&nbsp;January 2019. The standard eliminates the classification of leases as either operating or finance leases and introduces
a single accounting model. Lessees are required to recognise a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset and related lease liability for their operating leases and show depreciation of leased
assets and interest on lease liabilities separately in the income statement. IFRS 16 requires the Group to recognise substantially all of its operating leases on the balance sheet. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group adopted IFRS 16 effective 1&nbsp;January 2019 on a modified retrospective basis and applied the standard retrospectively with the cumulative
effect of initially applying the standard recognised at the date of initial application as an adjustment to retained earnings. Accordingly, prior year financial information has not been restated and will continue to be reported under IAS 17: Leases.
The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset and lease liability have initially been measured at the present value of the remaining lease payments, with the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset being subject to certain adjustments. For certain leases the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset was measured as if the
standard had been applied from the lease commencement date and for others the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset was set equal to the lease liability. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">When applying IFRS 16, the Group has applied the following practical expedients, on transition date: </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt">Reliance on the previous identification of a lease (as provided by IAS 17) for all contracts that existed on the date of
initial application; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt">Reliance on previous assessments on whether leases are onerous instead of performing an impairment review;
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt">Exclusion of initial direct costs from the measurement of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset at the date of initial application; </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt">The accounting for operating leases with a remaining lease term of less than 12 months as at 1&nbsp;January 2019 as
short-term leases; and </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="justify" STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt">The use of hindsight, such as in determining the lease term if the contract contains options to extend or terminate the
lease. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 20
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>2.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Accounting policies (continued) </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset
and lease liability recorded on the unaudited preliminary consolidated balance sheet as of 1&nbsp;January 2019 were &pound;1,895.1&nbsp;million and &pound;2,326.2&nbsp;million, respectively. There was a reduction in other creditors of
&pound;233.5&nbsp;million and property provisions of &pound;68.7&nbsp;million with regard to amounts related to property leases, including deferred rent and tenant improvement allowances, which are now recognised in the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset. These movements resulted in a decrease to retained earnings of &pound;128.9&nbsp;million and the recognition of a deferred tax asset of
&pound;27.8&nbsp;million on this movement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">For the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2019, depreciation of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset and recognition of interest on the lease liability in the unaudited preliminary consolidated income statement replaced amounts recognised as rent expense under IAS 17. The implementation of
IFRS 16 on 1&nbsp;January 2019 resulted in an increase to reported and headline operating profit of continuing operations (as defined in note 21) of &pound;61.0&nbsp;million and a subsequent increase to headline operating profit margin of 0.6 margin
points along with increased interest and a decrease to headline diluted earnings per share of 1.8p. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The following table reconciles the opening
balance for the lease liabilities as at 1&nbsp;January 2019 based upon the operating lease obligations as at 31&nbsp;December 2018: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial">Effect of discounting</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Lease liabilities at 1&nbsp;January 2019</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">2,326.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The weighted average discount rate was 5.4% at 1&nbsp;January 2019. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>IFRS 16: Leases </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group leases most of its offices in
cities where it operates. Other lease contracts include office equipment and motor vehicles. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">At inception of a contract, the Group assesses whether
a contract is, or contains, a lease based on whether the contract conveys the right to control the use of an identified asset for a period of time in exchange for consideration. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group recognises a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset and a lease liability at the
lease commencement date. The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> asset is initially measured based on the initial amount of the lease liability adjusted for any lease payments made at or
before the commencement date, plus any initial direct costs incurred, less any lease incentives received. The assets are depreciated over the term of the lease using the straight-line method. The lease term includes periods covered by an option to
extend if the Group is reasonably certain to exercise that option. <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Right-of-use</FONT></FONT> assets are reviewed for indicators of impairment. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The lease liability is initially measured at the present value of the lease payments that are not paid at the commencement date, discounted using the
interest rate implicit in the lease or, if that rate cannot be readily determined, the Group&#146;s incremental borrowing rate for the same term as the underlying lease. Lease payments included in the measurement of lease liabilities comprise fixed
payments less any lease incentives receivable and variable lease payments that depend on an index or a rate as at the commencement date. Lease modifications result in remeasurement of the lease liability. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Depreciation is recognised in both costs of services and general and administrative costs and interest expense is recognised under finance costs in the
unaudited preliminary consolidated income statement. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 21
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements (continued)
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>2.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Accounting policies (continued) </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group has elected to use the exemption not to recognise <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> assets and lease liabilities for short-term leases that have a lease term of 12 months or less and leases of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">low-value</FONT> assets. The payments associated with
these leases are recognised as cost of services and general and administrative costs on a straight-line basis over the lease term. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Impact of the adoption of
IFRIC 23: Uncertainty over Income Tax Treatments </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">IFRIC 23 clarifies the accounting for uncertainties in income tax and is effective from
1&nbsp;January 2019. There has been no impact to our financial statements as a result of the adoption of IFRIC 23. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>IFRS 5:
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">On 9&nbsp;July 2019 the Kantar business
was classified as held for sale following Board approval of the disposal of Kantar to Bain Capital. As required by IFRS 5, the Group <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-measured</FONT> Kantar at the lower of the carrying amount and fair value less
costs to sell, as set out in note 13. The first stage of the transaction completed on 5&nbsp;December 2019, consisting of approximately 90% of the Kantar group, with the remaining stages expected to complete in 2020. The portion of the business not
sold at 31&nbsp;December 2019 is classified as held for sale at this date. In accordance with IFRS 5, assets and liabilities classified as held for sale are shown as a separate line on the balance sheet. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">IFRS 5 also requires that the profit or loss from a discontinued operation is shown as a single amount on the face of the income statement and the
comparatives and related notes have been restated accordingly. This represents total <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">post-tax</FONT> profit of the disposal group for the whole of the financial year including any
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">post-tax</FONT> gain or loss on the measurement of fair value less costs to sell, as well as the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">post-tax</FONT> loss on sale of the disposal group completed by 31&nbsp;December 2019.
Kantar is presented as a discontinued operation for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2019. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Further details can be found in note 13. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Statutory information </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The financial information included in
this preliminary announcement does not constitute statutory accounts. The statutory accounts for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2018 have been delivered to the Jersey Registrar and received an unqualified auditors&#146; report. The statutory
accounts for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2019 will be finalised on the basis of the financial information presented by the directors in this unaudited preliminary announcement and will be delivered to the Jersey Registrar following the
Company&#146;s General Meeting. The audit report for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2019 has yet to be signed. The announcement of the preliminary results was approved on behalf of the board of directors on 27&nbsp;February 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>3.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Currency conversion </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The presentation currency of the Group is pound sterling and the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements have been prepared on this
basis. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The 2019 unaudited preliminary consolidated income statement is prepared using, among other currencies, average exchange rates of US$1.2765
to the pound (2018: US$1.3351) and <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#128;</FONT>1.1403 to the pound (2018: <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#128;</FONT>1.1303). The unaudited preliminary consolidated balance sheet as at
31&nbsp;December 2019 has been prepared using the exchange rates on that day of US$1.3263 to the pound (2018: US$1.2746) and <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#128;</FONT>1.1813 to the pound (2018:
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman">&#128;</FONT>1.1130). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The basis for calculating the constant currency percentage changes, shown on the
face of the unaudited preliminary consolidated income statement, is described in the glossary attached to this appendix. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Amortisation and impairment of acquired intangibles in 2019 includes an impairment charge in the year of
&pound;26.5&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;89.1 million) in regard to certain brand names that are no longer in use and customer relationships where the underlying clients have been lost. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The goodwill impairment charge of &pound;47.7&nbsp;million in 2019 relates to a number of under-performing businesses in the Group. In certain markets,
the impact of current, local economic conditions and trading circumstances on these businesses is sufficiently severe to indicate impairment to the carrying value of goodwill. In 2018, the goodwill impairment charge of &pound;183.9&nbsp;million
primarily relates to a charge of &pound;148.0&nbsp;million on VMLY&amp;R, with the remaining &pound;35.9&nbsp;million relating to a number of under-performing businesses in the Group. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Gains on disposal of investments and subsidiaries of &pound;40.4&nbsp;million in 2019 include a gain of &pound;28.6&nbsp;million on the disposal of the
Group&#146;s interest in Chime. Gains on disposal of investments and subsidiaries of &pound;237.9&nbsp;million in 2018 include a gain of &pound;185.3&nbsp;million on the disposal of the Group&#146;s interest in Globant S.A. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2019, restructuring and transformation costs of &pound;153.5&nbsp;million comprise &pound;116.3&nbsp;million of restructuring costs and
&pound;37.2&nbsp;million transformation costs with respect to strategic initiatives including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-locations</FONT> in major cities, IT transformation and shared services. Restructuring and transformation costs of
&pound;121.1&nbsp;million are in relation to the continuing restructuring plan, first outlined on the Investor Day in December 2018. As part of that plan, restructuring actions have been taken to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-size</FONT>
under-performing businesses, address high cost severance markets and simplify operational structures. Further restructuring and transformation costs will be incurred in 2020 and 2021. The remaining &pound;32.4&nbsp;million primarily comprises
transformation costs in relation to the continuing global IT transformation programme. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2018, restructuring and transformation costs of
&pound;265.5&nbsp;million comprise &pound;179.7&nbsp;million of restructuring costs and &pound;85.8&nbsp;million transformation costs with respect to strategic initiatives including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-locations</FONT> in major
cities, IT transformation and shared services. In the fourth quarter of 2018, &pound;212.3&nbsp;million of restructuring and transformation costs were incurred in relation to the strategic review of the Group&#146;s operations. The remaining
&pound;53.2&nbsp;million primarily relates to restructuring costs recorded in the first half of 2018 and transformation costs in relation to the IT transformation programme. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In 2019, the Group received &pound;16.8&nbsp;million in settlement of a class action lawsuit against Comscore Inc. for providing materially false and
misleading information regarding their company and its financial performance. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:42pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1
</SUP>Prior year figures have been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> in accordance with IFRS 5: <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, as described in note 2. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">2 </SUP>In 2019, amortisation and impairment of acquired intangible assets includes &pound;13.2&nbsp;million impairment of
brands with an indefinite useful life. </P>
</DIV></Center>

(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>4.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Costs of services and general and administrative costs (continued) </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In March 2019, the Group entered into a sale and leaseback agreement for its office space at 3 Columbus
Circle in New York. The Group sold the freehold for proceeds of &pound;159.0&nbsp;million and simultaneously entered into a 15 year lease. The net gain recognised from the sale and leaseback is &pound;7.9&nbsp;million. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Operating profit includes credits totalling &pound;26.9&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;25.6 million) relating to the release of excess provisions and other
balances established in respect of acquisitions completed prior to 2018. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Continuing operations</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 25
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>7.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Segmental analysis </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Recent restructuring actions, including the mergers of VMLY&amp;R and Wunderman Thompson, the One Ogilvy strategy and the reorganisation of our
specialist healthcare agencies, mean that certain units have been reclassified between the previously reported sectors. In order to take account of these changes, the internal reporting of the Group used by the Chief Executive Officer (the Chief
Operating Decision Maker) to review performance and allocate resources has also changed. The Group has therefore reassessed its segment information under IFRS 8: Operating Segments. In assessing the Group&#146;s reportable segments, the Directors
have considered the similar economic characteristics of certain operating segments, their shared client base and the similar nature of their products or services, amongst other factors. As a result, the Group&#146;s reportable segments have changed,
and comparatives have been restated as follows: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:20pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">15.2%</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:185pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP>Prior year figures have been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> in accordance
with IFRS 5: <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, as described in note 2. As a result, Data Investment Management is now excluded from the segment analysis. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">2</SUP> Global Integrated Agencies includes all of Grey, GroupM, Hogarth, Ogilvy, VMLY&amp;R and Wunderman
Thompson. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">3</SUP> Public Relations represents the Group&#146;s specialists in this area and remains
as previously reported but excludes Ogilvy PR which now sits within Global Integrated Agencies as part of Ogilvy. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">4</SUP> Specialist Agencies represent the Group&#146;s other agencies that specialise in certain areas, whether by region or range of services. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">5 </SUP>Revenue less pass-through costs is defined in note 21. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">6 </SUP>Headline operating profit is defined in note 21. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">7 </SUP>Headline operating profit margin is defined in note 21. </P>
</DIV></Center>

(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>8.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Taxation </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The tax rate on reported PBT was 28.0% (2018: 20.4%). The headline tax rate was 22.0% (2018: 20.7%). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The tax charge comprises: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>2019</B></FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
2018<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Continuing operations</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial">Headline tax charge</P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">320.1</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial">Headline tax rate</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">22.0</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">%&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">20.7</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">%&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Given the Group&#146;s geographic mix of profits and the changing international tax environment, the headline tax rate
is expected to increase slightly over the next few years. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The tax charge may also be affected by the impact of acquisitions, disposals and other
corporate restructurings, the resolution of open tax issues, and the ability to use brought forward tax losses. Changes in local or international tax rules, or challenges by tax or competition authorities, for example, the European Commission&#146;s
state aid decision into Group Financing Exemption in the UK CFC rules, may expose the Group to additional tax liabilities or impact the carrying value of deferred tax assets, which could affect the future tax charge. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group does not currently expect any material additional charges, or credits, to arise in respect of these matters, beyond the amounts already
provided. Liabilities relating to these open and judgemental matters are based upon estimates of whether additional taxes will be due after taking into account external advice where appropriate. Where the final tax outcome of these matters is
different from the amounts which were initially recorded then such differences will impact the current and deferred income tax assets and liabilities in the period in which such determination is made. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:80pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:21%">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP>Prior year figures have been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> in accordance with IFRS 5: <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, as described in note 2. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">2 </SUP>Headline PBT is defined in note 21. </P>
</DIV></Center>

 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>9.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Ordinary dividends </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Board has recommended a final dividend of 37.3p (2018: 37.3p) per ordinary share in addition to the interim dividend of 22.7p (2018: 22.7p) per
share. This makes a total for the year of 60.0p (2018: 60.0p). Payment of the final dividend of 37.3p per ordinary share will be made on 6&nbsp;July 2020 to holders of ordinary shares in the Company on 12&nbsp;June 2020. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>11.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Analysis of cash flows </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The following tables analyse the items included within the main cash flow headings on page 15: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Net cash inflow from operating activities: </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&pound; million</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>2019</B></FONT></TD>

(2018: &pound;5,965.7 million). The carrying value of corporate bonds is &pound;4,162.9&nbsp;million at 31&nbsp;December 2019 (31&nbsp;December 2018: &pound;6,051.6 million). The Group considers that the carrying amount of bank loans at
31&nbsp;December 2019 of &pound;110.4&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;186.8 million) approximates their fair value. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The following table is an analysis

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">(4,016.7)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>13.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Assets held for sale and discontinued operations </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">On 12&nbsp;July 2019, the Group announced the proposed sale of its Kantar business to Bain Capital. On 5&nbsp;December 2019 the first stage of the
transaction completed with consideration of &pound;2,140.2&nbsp;million after tax and disposal costs. The sale involved the Group disposing of the Kantar business and holding a 40% equity stake post-transaction which is treated as an associate. This
generated a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of &pound;73.8&nbsp;million, tax charge of &pound;157.4&nbsp;million and goodwill impairment of &pound;94.5&nbsp;million for the Group. The remaining stages of the transaction are
expected to complete in 2020 with further consideration expected to be approximately &pound;200&nbsp;million after tax and disposal costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Under
IFRS 5: <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-current</FONT> Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations where certain conditions are met, an asset or disposal group that has been put up for sale should be recognised as &#145;held for
sale&#146;. An entity should classify a disposal group as held for sale if the carrying amount will be recovered principally through a sale transaction rather than through continuing use. For this to be the case, the disposal group must be available
for immediate sale in its present condition subject only to terms that are usual and customary for sales of such assets and its sale must be highly probable. The criterion of highly probable was met on 9&nbsp;July 2019, following Board approval of
the disposal of Kantar to Bain Capital, representing the date at which the appropriate level of management was committed to a plan to sell the disposal group. The Kantar disposal group therefore became held for sale on this date. This classifies as
a critical accounting judgement under IAS 1: Presentation of Financial Statements at 31&nbsp;December 2019. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Kantar group (both the portion that
has been disposed of by year end and the portion that is expected to be disposed of in 2020) is classified as a discontinued operation in 2019 under IFRS 5, as it forms a separate major line of business and there was a single <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">co-ordinated</FONT> plan to dispose of it. Kantar represents materially all of the data investment management segment of the Group. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 33
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements (continued)
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>13.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Assets held for sale and discontinued operations (continued) </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">As at 31&nbsp;December 2019 the Kantar group is therefore disclosed as a discontinued operation with
the remaining portion of the company not yet sold by year end disclosed as held for sale. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Results of the discontinued operations, which have been

<P STYLE="font-size:60pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP>Under IFRS 5, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-current</FONT> assets are not depreciated or amortised whilst classified as held for sale. In addition, when an associate is classified as held for
sale, equity accounting will cease. This means that there is no depreciation, amortisation or share of results of associates taken for the Kantar group from 9&nbsp;July 2019. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">2 </SUP>Headline tax consists of the tax charge of &pound;78.8&nbsp;million (2018:
&pound;67.9 million) excluding &pound;22.1&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;17.2 million) deferred tax credit in relation to the amortisation of acquired intangible assets, &pound;1.9&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;11.0 million) tax credit relating to
restructuring and transformation costs, &pound;1.7&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;nil) deferred tax charge relating to interests in associates and joint ventures and in 2018, a &pound;2.7&nbsp;million tax credit in relation to the impact of the US tax
reform. </P>
</DIV></Center>

<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Re-investment</FONT> in equity stake represents the value of the Group&#146;s 40% stake in the new Kantar group as part of the disposal. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-right:5%; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">2 </SUP>Deferred consideration is made up of &pound;79.6&nbsp;million expected to be
received in future periods on the satisfaction of certain conditions and the deferral of &pound;78.0&nbsp;million consideration against services the Group will supply to Kantar on favourable terms in the future. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 36
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 38
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>15.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Goodwill and acquisitions </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Goodwill in relation to subsidiary undertakings decreased by &pound;3,032.1&nbsp;million (2018: increased by &pound;249.9 million) in the year. This
movement primarily relates to the sale of Kantar as discussed in note 2, the effect of currency translation and impairment charges of &pound;47.7&nbsp;million. This movement also includes both goodwill arising on acquisitions completed in the year
and adjustments to goodwill relating to acquisitions completed in prior years. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The contribution to revenue and operating profit of acquisitions
completed in the year was not material. There were no material acquisitions completed during the year or between 31&nbsp;December 2019 and the date these preliminary consolidated financial statements were approved. </P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group has applied the practical expedient permitted by IFRS 15 to not disclose the transaction price allocated to
performance obligations unsatisfied (or partially unsatisfied) as of the end of the reporting period as contracts typically have an original expected duration of a year or less. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">For continuing operations, a bad debt expense of &pound;25.8&nbsp;million (2018: &pound;49.0 million) was recognised on the Group&#146;s trade
receivables in the year. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group considers that the carrying amount of trade and other receivables approximates their fair value. </P>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 40
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>21.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Alternative measures of performance </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Management includes <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures as they consider these measures to be both useful and necessary. They are
used by management for internal performance analyses; the presentation of these measures facilitates comparability with other companies, although management&#146;s measures may not be calculated in the same way as similarly titled measures reported
by other companies; and these measures are useful in connection with discussions with the investment community. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Reconciliation of revenue to revenue less
pass-through costs: </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">10,875.7</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Pass-through costs comprise fees paid to external suppliers when they are engaged to perform part or all of a specific
project and are charged directly to clients, predominantly media and data collection costs. This includes the cost of media where the Group is buying digital media for its own account on a transparent <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">opt-in</FONT>
basis and, as a result, the subsequent media pass-through costs have to be accounted for as revenue, as well as billings. Therefore, management considers that revenue less pass-through costs gives a helpful reflection of <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">top-line</FONT> growth. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Reconciliation of operating profit to headline operating profit: </B></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline operating profit is one of the metrics that management uses to assess the performance of the business.<SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"> </SUP> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Headline operating profit margin before and after share of results of associates: </B></P>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Headline EBITDA</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">2,131.4</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">1,932.5</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline EBITDA is a key metric that private equity firms, for example, use for valuing companies, and is one of the
metrics that management uses to assess the performance of the business. Headline EBITDA (including depreciation of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> assets) is used in the Group&#146;s key
leverage metric. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Calculation of headline <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests: </B></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline PBT and headline earnings are metrics that management use to assess the performance of the business. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:80pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>

subsidiary undertakings</P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">(96.2</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">)&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">(106.2</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">)&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Free cash flow</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">1,044.2</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">1,093.4</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.50pt solid #7f7f7f"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group bases its internal cash flow objectives on free cash flow. Management believes free cash flow is meaningful to
investors because it is the measure of the Group&#146;s funds available for acquisition related payments, dividends to shareholders, share repurchases and debt repayment. The purpose of presenting free cash flow is to indicate the ongoing cash
generation within the control of the Group after taking account of the necessary cash expenditures of maintaining the capital and operating structure of the Group (in the form of payments of interest, corporate taxation and capital expenditure).
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Performance measures including Kantar </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Like-for-like</FONT></FONT> revenue less pass-through costs and headline operating margin including Kantar reflect the full year performance as if Kantar was owned by the Group throughout
the entirety of 2019 adjusted to remove the effects of held for sale accounting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Constant currency and pro forma <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(&#145;like-for-like&#146;)</FONT></FONT> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">These preliminary consolidated financial statements are presented in
pounds sterling. However, the Group&#146;s significant international operations give rise to fluctuations in foreign exchange rates. To neutralise foreign exchange impact and illustrate the underlying change in revenue and profit from one year to
the next, the Group has adopted the practice of discussing results in both reportable currency (local currency results translated into pounds sterling at the prevailing foreign exchange rate) and constant currency. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Management also believes that discussing pro forma or <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">like-for-like</FONT></FONT>
contributes to the understanding of the Group&#146;s performance and trends because it allows for meaningful comparisons of the current year to that of prior years. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Further details of the constant currency and pro forma methods are given in the glossary on page 47. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:85pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:24%">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1 </SUP>Prior year free cash flow has been <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">re-presented</FONT> to exclude proceeds on
disposal of property, plant and equipment. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 43
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>22.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Going concern and liquidity risk </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">In considering going concern and liquidity risk, the directors have reviewed the Group&#146;s future
cash requirements and earnings projections. The directors believe these forecasts have been prepared on a prudent basis and have also considered the impact of a range of potential changes to trading performance. The directors have concluded that the
Group should be able to operate within its current facilities and comply with its banking covenants for the foreseeable future and therefore believe it is appropriate to prepare the financial statements of the Group on a going concern basis. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">At 31&nbsp;December 2019, the Group has access to &pound;6.3&nbsp;billion of committed facilities with maturity dates spread over the years 2020 to 2046
as illustrated below: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:7pt" ALIGN="center">

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Given the strong cash generation of the business, its debt maturity profile and available facilities, the directors
believe the Group has sufficient liquidity to match its requirements for the foreseeable future. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Treasury management </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s treasury activities are principally concerned with monitoring of working capital, managing external and internal funding requirements
and monitoring and managing financial market risks, in particular risks from movements in interest and foreign exchange rates. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s
risk management policies relating to foreign currency risk, interest rate risk, liquidity risk, capital risk and credit risk are presented in the notes to the consolidated financial statements of the 2018 Annual Report and Accounts and in the
opinion of the Board remain relevant at 31&nbsp;December 2019. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 44
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>23.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Financial instruments </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The fair values of financial assets and liabilities are based on quoted market prices where available.
Where the market value is not available, the Group has estimated relevant fair values on the basis of publicly available information from outside sources or on the basis of discounted cash flow models where appropriate. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The following table provides an analysis of financial instruments that are measured subsequent to initial recognition at fair value, grouped into levels
1 to 3 based on the degree to which the fair value is observable, or based on observable inputs: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Level&nbsp;1 fair value measurements are those
derived from quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Level&nbsp;2 fair value measurements are those
derived from inputs other than quoted prices included within level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly (i.e. as prices) or indirectly (i.e. derived from prices); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Level&nbsp;3 fair value measurements are those derived from valuation techniques that include inputs for the asset or liability that are not based on
observable market data (unobservable inputs). </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">-</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Arial">Settlements</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #4f81b3"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; ">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 45
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
(continued) </B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>23.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Financial instruments (continued) </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Payments due to vendors and liabilities in respect of put options </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Future anticipated payments due to vendors in respect of contingent consideration (earnout agreements) are recorded at fair value, which is the present
value of the expected cash outflows of the obligations. Liabilities in respect of put option agreements are initially recorded at the present value of the redemption amount in accordance with IAS 32 and subsequently measured at fair value in
accordance with IFRS 9. Both types of obligations are dependent on the future financial performance of the entity and it is assumed that future profits are in line with directors&#146; estimates. The directors derive their estimates from internal
business plans together with financial due diligence performed in connection with the acquisition. At 31&nbsp;December 2019, the weighted average growth rate in estimating future financial performance was 19.5%, which reflects the prevalence of
recent acquisitions in the faster growing markets and new media sectors. The risk adjusted discount rate applied to these obligations at 31&nbsp;December 2019 was 1.4%. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">A one percentage point increase or decrease in the growth rate in estimated future financial performance would increase or decrease the combined
liabilities due to earnout agreements and put options by approximately &pound;4.6&nbsp;million and &pound;7.7&nbsp;million, respectively. A 0.5 percentage point increase or decrease in the risk adjusted discount rate would decrease or increase the
combined liabilities by approximately &pound;5.6&nbsp;million and &pound;5.7&nbsp;million, respectively. An increase in the liability would result in a loss in the revaluation of financial instruments (note 6), while a decrease would result in a
gain. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Other investments </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The fair value of other
investments included in level 1 are based on quoted market prices. Other investments included in level 3 are unlisted securities, where market value is not readily available. The Group has estimated relevant fair values on the basis of publicly
available information from outside sources. Certain investments are valued using revenue multiples. An increase or decrease in this multiple of one times revenue would result in an increase or decrease in the value of investments of
&pound;53.6&nbsp;million, which would result in a credit or charge to the income statement of &pound;3.3&nbsp;million and equity of &pound;50.3&nbsp;million. The sensitivity to changes in unobservable inputs for certain other investments is specific
to each individual investment. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 46
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Notes to the unaudited preliminary consolidated financial statements
