<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><B>24.</B></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify"><B>Principal and emerging risks and uncertainties </B></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Board regularly reviews the principal and emerging risks and uncertainties affecting the Group and these are summarised below: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Clients </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group competes for clients in a highly competitive and evolving industry which is undergoing structural change.
Client loss or consolidation or a reduction in marketing budgets due to economic conditions, may have a material adverse effect on the Group&#146;s market share and its business, revenues, results of operations, financial condition or prospects.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group receives a significant portion of its revenues from a limited number of large clients and the net loss of
one or more of these clients could have a material adverse effect on the Group&#146;s prospects, business, financial condition and results of operations. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Data and Cyber Security </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">Data protection laws concerning user privacy, collection and use of personal information, consent and online tracking
may restrict the Group&#146;s activities and increase our costs. The loss of personal data controlled by the Group and regulatory action and or fines may have a material adverse effect on the Group&#146;s financial condition or prospects.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group is undertaking a series of IT transformation programmes to support the Group&#146;s strategic plan and a
failure or delay in implanting the IT programmes may have a material adverse effect on its business, revenues, results of operations, financial conditions or prospects. The Group is reliant on third parties for the performance of a significant part
of its information technology and operational functions. A failure to provide these functions including as a result of a cyber event, could have an adverse effect on the Group&#146;s business. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group stores, transmits and relies on critical and sensitive data. Security of this type of data is exposed to
escalating external cyber threats that are increasing in sophistication as well as internal breaches. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Financial </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group is subject to credit risk through the default of a client or other counterparty. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Operational </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s performance could be adversely impacted if it failed to ensure adequate internal control procedures
are in place generally and in relation to the Group&#146;s media trading. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; " COLOR="#181b6b">&#8718;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group is part way through a three-year strategic plan to return the business to growth by the end of 2021. A
failure or delay in implementing the strategic plan may have a material adverse effect on the Group&#146;s market share and its business, revenues, results of operations, financial condition or prospects. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>People, Culture and Succession </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s performance could be adversely affected if it were unable to embed the right culture across the Group
and attract and retain key talent or had inadequate talent management and succession planning for key management roles across the Group. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Regulatory, Sanctions, Anti-Trust and Taxation </B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group may be subject to regulations restricting its activities or effecting changes in taxation.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group is subject to anti-corruption, anti-bribery and anti-trust legislation and enforcement in the countries in
which it operates. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

state securities laws may not be enforceable in the United States or in England and Wales or in Jersey. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

the supply of services to certain countries. Failure to comply with these laws could expose the Group to civil and criminal penalties. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>Emerging
</B></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">The Group&#146;s operations could be disrupted by an increased frequency of extreme weather and climate-related
natural disasters as a consequence of the physical impacts of climate change in the next 30 years. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">These principal risks and
uncertainties have been reviewed and updated since the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2018 which were set out on pages 78 to 83 of the 2018 Annual Report and Accounts. </P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><FONT COLOR="#7f7f7f">
 47
 </FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:12pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Glossary and basis of preparation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Average net debt and net debt </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Average net debt is calculated as the average daily net borrowings of the Group. Net debt at a period end is calculated as the sum of the net borrowings
of the Group, derived from the cash ledgers and accounts in the balance sheet. Net debt excludes lease liabilities. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Billings and estimated net new billings </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Billings comprise the gross amounts billed to clients in respect of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">commission-based/fee-based</FONT> income together
with the total of other fees earned. Net new billings represent the estimated annualised impact on billings of new business gained from both existing and new clients, net of existing client business lost. The estimated impact is based upon initial
assessments of the clients&#146; marketing budgets, which may not necessarily result in actual billings of the same amount. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Constant currency </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The Group uses US dollar-based, constant currency models to measure performance. These are calculated by applying budgeted 2019 exchange rates to local
currency reported results for the current and prior year, which excludes any variances attributable to foreign exchange rate movements. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
 COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Exceptional gains/losses </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Exceptional gains/losses include gains/losses on disposal of investments and subsidiaries,
gains/losses on remeasurement of equity interests arising from a change in scope of ownership, investment write-downs, litigation settlement, gain on sale of freehold property in New York, restructuring and transformation costs and share of
exceptional gains/losses of associates. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Free cash flow </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Free cash flow is calculated as cash generated by operations plus dividends received from associates, interest received, investment income received, and
proceeds from the issue of shares, less corporation and overseas tax paid, interest and similar charges paid, dividends paid to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests in subsidiary undertakings, repayment of lease
liabilities (including interest), earnout payments and purchases of property, plant and equipment and purchases of other intangible assets. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
 COLOR="#181b6b"><B>General and administrative costs </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">General and administrative costs include marketing costs, certain professional fees
and an allocation of other costs, including staff and establishment costs, based on the function of employees within the Group. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT
 COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline earnings </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline PBT less headline tax charge and headline
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline EBITDA </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Profit before finance income/costs and revaluation of financial instruments, taxation, gains/losses on disposal of investments and subsidiaries,
investment write-downs, goodwill impairment and other goodwill write-downs, amortisation and impairment of acquired intangible assets, amortisation of other intangibles, depreciation of property, plant and equipment, depreciation of <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</FONT></FONT> assets, restructuring and transformation costs, litigation settlement, gain on sale of freehold property in New York, share of exceptional gains/losses of
associates and gains/losses on remeasurement of equity interests arising from a change in scope of ownership. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-controlling</FONT> interests excluding <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-controlling</FONT> interests relating to restructuring and transformation costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline
operating profit </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Operating profit before gains/losses on disposal of investments and subsidiaries, investment write-downs, goodwill
impairment and other goodwill write-downs, amortisation and impairment of acquired intangible assets, restructuring and transformation costs, litigation settlement, gain on sale of freehold property in New York and gains/losses on remeasurement of
equity interests arising from a change in scope of ownership. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline PBIT </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Profit before finance income/costs and revaluation of financial instruments, taxation, gains/losses on disposal of investments and subsidiaries,
investment write-downs, goodwill impairment and other goodwill write-downs, amortisation and impairment of acquired intangible assets, restructuring and transformation costs, litigation settlement, gain on sale of freehold property in New York,
share of exceptional gains/losses of associates and gains/losses on remeasurement of equity interests arising from a change in scope of ownership. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline operating profit margin </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Headline operating profit margin is calculated as headline operating profit as a percentage of revenue less pass-through costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline PBT </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Profit before taxation, gains/losses on disposal of investments and subsidiaries, investment write-downs, goodwill impairment and other goodwill
write-downs, amortisation and impairment of acquired intangible assets, restructuring and transformation costs, litigation settlement, gain on sale of freehold property in New York, share of exceptional gains/losses of associates, gains/losses
arising from the revaluation of financial instruments and gains/losses on remeasurement of equity interests arising from a change in scope of ownership. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Headline tax charge </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Taxation excluding tax/deferred tax relating to gains on disposal of investments and subsidiaries, tax credit relating to gain on sale of freehold
property in New York, tax charge relating to litigation settlement, deferred tax impact of the amortisation of acquired intangible assets and other goodwill items, the tax impact of the 2017 US tax reform and tax credit relating to restructuring and
transformation costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Net working capital </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The movement in net working capital consists of movements in trade working capital and movements in other working capital and provisions per the
analysis of cash flows note. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Pass-through costs </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Pass-through costs comprise fees paid to external suppliers where they are engaged to perform part or all of a specific project and are charged directly
to clients, predominantly media and data collection costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Pro forma <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(&#145;like-for-like&#146;)</FONT></FONT> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Pro forma comparisons are calculated as follows: current year,
constant currency actual results (which include acquisitions from the relevant date of completion) are compared with prior year, constant currency actual results, adjusted to include the results of acquisitions and disposals for the commensurate
period in the prior year. The Group uses the terms &#145;pro forma&#146; and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">&#145;like-for-like&#146;</FONT></FONT> interchangeably. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify"><FONT COLOR="#181b6b"><B>Revenue less pass-through costs </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:7.5pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Revenue less pass-through costs is revenue less media, data collection and other pass-through costs. </P>
</DIV></Center>

</BODY></HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.2
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>d894455dex992.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 2
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Exhibit 2</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">


<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 2 </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">


<TR>

<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial"><B>For Immediate Release</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Arial; "><B>28&nbsp;February 2020</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="center"><B>WPP PLC (&#147;WPP&#148;)</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="center"><B>Share repurchase agreement </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">WPP announces
that it has entered into an agreement with Goldman Sachs International (&#147;Goldman Sachs&#148;) on 28&nbsp;February 2020 in relation to the purchase by Goldman Sachs of WPP&#146;s ordinary shares of 10 pence each (&#147;Ordinary Shares&#148;) for
an aggregate purchase price of up to &pound;150m (the &#147;Programme&#148;). Shares acquired by Goldman Sachs under the agreement will be simultaneously <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">on-sold</FONT> by Goldman Sachs to WPP. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">The purchase of shares in accordance with the Programme is expected to commence shortly after 28&nbsp;February 2020 and a further announcement will be
made upon completion. The purpose of the Programme is to reduce the share capital of WPP. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Any purchase of Ordinary Shares contemplated by this
announcement will be carried out on the London Stock Exchange and/or other trading venues<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP> and will be effected within certain <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-set</FONT> parameters.
WPP&#146;s shareholders generally authorised WPP to purchase up to a maximum of 126,188,373 Ordinary Shares at its 2019 Annual General Meeting held on 12&nbsp;June 2019, subject to certain limitations (the &#147;Authority&#148;). The aggregate
number of Ordinary Shares acquired by the Company pursuant to the Programme shall not exceed the maximum number of Ordinary Shares which the Company is authorised to purchase pursuant to the Authority. The Authority expires on the earlier of the
date of the Annual General Meeting of the Company to be held in 2020 and 1&nbsp;September 2020. The Programme will be executed in accordance with (and subject to the limits prescribed by) the Authority and will be conducted within the parameters
prescribed by the Market Abuse Regulation 596/2014, the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/1052 and in accordance with Chapter 12 of the Listing Rules. Any market repurchase of Ordinary Shares will be announced no later than 7.30am on the
business day following the calendar day on which the repurchase occurred. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">Goldman Sachs will make any disclosures it is legally required to make in
relation to such transactions. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:Arial; " ALIGN="justify">Includes BATS, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Chi-X</FONT> and Turquoise </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Arial" ALIGN="justify">For further information: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="50%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:9pt">

the statements contained herein, please refer to public filings by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The statements in this announcement should be considered in light of these risks and uncertainties. </P>
